image.altText: A young woman with long black hair holds a baby girl in her arms standing in a kitchen

props.synopsis: Women who have spent years navigating the health system seeking care for extreme pain say they are frustrated at the slow pace of a government inquiry into the issue.

title.children: 'It's not right': Frustration as Australian-first women's pain inquiry in limbo

image.altText: A close-up of someone wearing a t-shirt depicting Clinton Austin.

props.synopsis: A nurse who treated a First Nations man the morning he died in a central Victorian prison has told an inquest she "should have been more thorough".

title.children: Nurse breaks down in court recounting prisoner's death

image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: Two people have been arrested after a woman was allegedly pushed out of her vehicle during an early morning carjacking at a school car park on Wednesday.

title.children: Pair charged over alleged carjacking in school car park near Geelong

image.altText: A woman standing in front of her car.

props.synopsis: Police alleged Erin Patterson had poisoned her husband Simon several times, before she served his parents and aunt a beef Wellington lunch containing death cap mushrooms.

title.children: Erin Patterson denied poisoning husband using toxic pasta and chicken curry

image.altText: Cast of five performers standing on stage.

props.synopsis: A critically acclaimed Australian stage adaptation of George Orwell's novel 1984 attracts full houses as it tours across the nation.

title.children: Dystopian George Orwell classic 1984 finds new audience on stage

image.altText: James Tomkins drapped in the Australian flag, in front of the Olympic rings, looking over his right shoulder

props.synopsis: A Victorian study has found elite male rowers are seven times more likely to develop atrial fibrillation, a common heart rhythm disorder associated with increased risk of stroke.

title.children: Could 'too much' exercise lead to a heart disorder in elite athletes?

image.altText: Brad Green and Simon Goodwin speak to the media

props.synopsis: High demands and increasingly 'abhorrent' abuse from fans is putting modern AFL coaches under enormous pressure, according to those in the industry.

title.children: Sacking an AFL coach has become a brutal, public spectacle

image.altText: A multi-storey building with arch windows and pink bricks and a Mecca sign on the front.

props.synopsis: About 20,000 people are expected to rush through the doors of cosmetic giant Mecca's new store on its opening day. But is the hype enough to revive Melbourne's hushed CBD after the pandemic?

title.children: The opening of a megastore reflects the revival of retail in Melbourne's CBD

image.altText: noni Hazlehurst, with fair long hair and fringe, sits near a front bar at a pub, smiling with closed mouth.

props.synopsis: After the huge success of her first one-woman show, Mother, Noni Hazlehurst sits down with ABC Arts to speak frankly about her new show and the powerful publican at the centre of it.

title.children: Why Noni Hazlehurst wants to play characters society ignores

image.altText: Cockatoo dancing

props.synopsis: Cockatoos can headbang, body roll and sidestep intentionally to music according to a new study. One bird recorded 257 dance moves while listening to music for 20 minutes.

title.children: Cockatoos that feel the beat have distinct dance moves, study shows

image.altText: A group of Western United A-League men's players walk off the ground after a game with heads down or looking dejected.

props.synopsis: Just three years after winning the A-League title, Western United is stripped of its licence by Football Australia.

title.children: Beleaguered Western United stripped of A-League licence in 'regrettable' decision

image.altText: A group of cheerleaders launches one of their peers into the air during a cheerleading competition.

props.synopsis: Tiffany Maestrale, 17, combines competitive cheerleading with a love of sheep judging.

title.children: Cheerleading skills translate to judging sheep for versatile teen

image.altText: The sign at The Alfred hospital in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: The Alfred Hospital apologises to three patients and their families after a power outage forced doctors to pause procedures mid-operation.

title.children: Melbourne hospital issues apology after mid-surgery power outage

image.altText: A photo of the Monash University law chambers in Melbourne's CBD.

props.synopsis: A former judge and legal academic accused of inadvertently showing child abuse material to university students is granted bail, with a court hearing he spent a "serious amount of money" on an upcoming trip.

title.children: Academic facing child abuse material charges bailed to travel to Europe

image.altText: Stingray swimming in port phillip bay

props.synopsis: This fragile reef is just a few hundred metres from a popular Melbourne beach, and a group of passionate community members are doing all they can to save it.

title.children: 'Snorkel sisters' join fight to protect fragile reef off Melbourne beach

image.altText: Aunty Joy Murphy Wandin delivers a Welcome To Country

props.synopsis: Wurundjeri Woi-wurrung elder Aunty Joy Murphy Wandin has said she will attend Thursday night's Melbourne Storm home game despite ongoing concerns with the club's board.

title.children: Wurundjeri elder Aunty Joy to attend Storm NRL match despite ongoing issues with board

image.altText: Jeremy Howe being stretchered off MCG.

props.synopsis: Veteran Collingwood defender Jeremy Howe is recovering well following a nasty collision in the Magpies' heavy defeat to Hawthorn.

title.children: Howe cleared of further injury after suffering concussion in Magpies' loss

image.altText: Jack Silvagni carries the ball against Collingwood

props.synopsis: The Western Bulldogs coach declines to talk about the club's chase of Jack Silvagni, but admitted every club is on the hunt for good free agents.

title.children: Free agent Silvagni has 'antennas up' around the AFL, says Beveridge

image.altText: Electricians place solar panels on roof

props.synopsis: As Australia's energy transition hits turbulence, a quiet but fundamental shift is underway.

title.children: Can Australia's staggering 'small-scale flex' save our energy future?

image.altText: Peter Wright wins a ruck against Ned Moyle.

props.synopsis: The Gold Coast Suns' bid for their first finals appearance could come down to the last Wednesday of August, with the AFL locking in a time for the postponed Opening Round fixture.

title.children: Critical game in AFL finals race scheduled for a Wednesday night

image.altText: Analyn 'Logee' Osias smiles for a selfie with the sun softly shining on tents behind her.

props.synopsis: Victoria's highest court rejects an appeal by prosecutors to increase the sentence of a man convicted of the "brutal" murder of his former partner in Bendigo.

title.children: Judges quash appeal for harsher sentences for intimate partner violence

image.altText: Carlton public housing towers

props.synopsis: Almost one in five households displaced by a controversial plan to redevelop Melbourne’s public housing towers have been placed in the private market, a parliamentary inquiry has heard.

title.children: Dozens of public housing residents now in private homes ahead of demolition

image.altText: Hands folded over a lap

props.synopsis: Some people facing housing pressure on the state's Bass Coast are opting to camp in the bush instead of spending most of their pay on rent.

title.children: Camping on rise in Victorian region where social housing in high demand

image.altText: A man in a baseball cap and black tee smiles at a camera

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old Mildura man convicted of secretly filming an intimate act with a woman using a camera hidden in a wardrobe avoids a prison sentence.

title.children: Victorian man fined for using hidden camera to film secret sex tape

image.altText: Inside the historical Mortlock Wing of the State Library of South Australia.

props.synopsis: Adelaide's premier library has been recognised by the 1000 Libraries Awards as second most beautiful in the world, while Victoria has snagged seventh spot.

title.children: Libraries in SA and Victoria among top 10 most beautiful in the world

image.altText: Police attend the scene of a collision between a van and a truck on a road, in which the van was badly damaged.

props.synopsis: The male driver of a van that crashed into the back of a truck in Ravenhall has died.

title.children: One dead after van crushed under parked truck in Melbourne's west

image.altText: Two women hold framed photos of a man and woman.

props.synopsis: The family of siblings killed in a head-on crash in Central Victoria last year says there has been no justice after a 12-month police investigation.

title.children: Family seeks answers after driver in double-fatal crash avoids charges

image.altText: A house in a large green field.

props.synopsis: Building a house on the wrong block of land does not happen very often, but it happens enough that some states and countries have laws in place to deal with it.

title.children: What the law says about building a house on the wrong block

image.altText: An image of a Toxoplasma Gondii parasite pictured in green, purple and pink.

props.synopsis: International researchers develop a tool to detect toxoplasmosis, a mind-altering parasite that is believed to infect a third of the world's population.

title.children: Online test to detect parasite may lead to learning about behaviour changes

image.altText: Simon Goodwin and Paul Roos with their arms crossed

props.synopsis: Paul Roos says Melbourne's stars have plenty to play for in the final three games of the season, adding that Simon Goodwin can't have been blindsided by the club's decision to sack him.

title.children: 'Do that at your own peril': Roos warns Demons after coach's sacking

image.altText: A man folds his arms outside a house being built

props.synopsis: Residents in Victoria petition to have input on rooming houses opening near their homes, citing concerns about the potential number of occupants and increased traffic.

title.children: Neighbours want a say in rooming house developments

image.altText: A composite image with two pictures of a left hand with stitches from the index finger down to the wrist.

props.synopsis: A man who almost lost his hand in a machete attack at a Melbourne shopping centre has called into question security measures and is pleading for the government to act.

title.children: 'Not safe anywhere': Machete attacks instil fears in victims and witnesses

image.altText: A doctor talks to a patient in an office.

props.synopsis: Some GPs are now relying on artificial intelligence to take notes during patient consultations. So, how safe is our sensitive information?

title.children: The AI used in '200,000' doctor consultations per week

image.altText: A rocky granite island in the ocean.

props.synopsis: When Tasmania broke away from New South Wales politically in the 19th century it was decided all islands south of Wilsons Promontory would belong to the new colony, but it didn't quite work out that way.

title.children: Charting bungle created 'land border' between Tasmania and Victoria

image.altText: A predominantly white magpie with light brown marbling stands on a patch of green and brown grass with its focus on the ground.

props.synopsis: A bird expert says it appears to have leucism, which affects about one in 30,000 birds and is often confused with albinism.

title.children: Rare white magpie sighted near Melbourne
